definitions.text: an average of n numbers computed by adding some function of the numbers and dividing by some function of n
mean or intend to express or convey
examples: You never understand what I mean!
what do his words intend?
The water shortage means that we have to stop taking long showers
`maison' means `house' in French
An example sentence would show what this word means

definitions.text: have in mind as a purpose
examples: I mean no harm
I only meant to help you
She didn't think to harm me
We thought to return early that night

definitions.text: have a specified degree of importance
examples: My ex-husband means nothing to me
Happiness means everything
I'm thinking of good food when I talk about France
Yes, I meant you when I complained about people who gossip!

definitions.text: destine or designate for a certain purpose
examples: These flowers were meant for you

definitions.text: approximating the statistical norm or average or expected value
examples: the average income in New England is below that of the nation
of average height for his age
the mean annual rainfall
a hateful thing to do
in a mean mood

definitions.text: having or showing an ignoble lack of honor or morality; - Edmund Burke; ; - Shakespeare
examples: that liberal obedience without which your army would be a base rabble
taking a mean advantage
chok'd with ambition of the meaner sort
something essentially vulgar and meanspirited in politics
famous for a mean backhand

definitions.text: marked by poverty befitting a beggar
examples: a beggarly existence in the slums
a mean hut

definitions.text: (used of persons or behavior) characterized by or indicative of lack of generosity
examples: a mean person
he left a miserly tip

definitions.text: (used of sums of money) so small in amount as to deserve contempt

examples: I was caught in the bastardly traffic
